summary:
The Andromeda Galaxy, also known as Messier 31, is a spiral galaxy close to our Milky Way. It got its name from the constellation Andromeda, inspired by Greek mythology. Andromeda is about 2.5 million light-years away and is the largest galaxy in the Local Group.

Scientists believe that Andromeda and the Milky Way will collide and merge in the future, creating a new galaxy. Andromeda can be seen with the naked eye on clear, moonless nights, appearing as a bright, hazy spot.
title: Andromeda Galaxy
